availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew G. Kyle (Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Jane H. Kyle. Father of John G. Kyle and Thomas Kyle. Chairman of meeting of the friends of emancipation and colonization in Mercer County in April 1849. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850 and 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in 1850 and eighteen in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 2, p. 347; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 2; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 31; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 7-8; "Public Meeting in Mercer," The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), April 19, 1849, p. 2; Find A Grave, "Andrew G. Kyle (1796-1872)," Memorial #100136706, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=100136706 (accessed March 13, 2017).
